thread.title: 'Zootopia' wins best animated feature at Annie Awards
thread.title_full: 'Zootopia' wins best animated feature at Annie Awards

author: AP
title: 'Zootopia' wins best animated feature at Annie Awards
text:
'Zootopia' wins best animated feature at Annie Awards After taking six awards, the Disney movie enters the Oscars as an obvious favorite. Post to Facebook 'Zootopia' wins best animated feature at Annie Awards After taking six awards, the Disney movie enters the Oscars as an obvious favorite.  //usat.ly/2kbqhu4   Join the Nation's Conversation To   'Zootopia' wins best animated feature at Annie Awards AP 5:04 p.m. ET Feb. 5, 2017 CLOSE x Share The first rabbit to join the police force in peaceful 'Zootopia' must prove she has the chops to crack a bewildering case of animals going wild. VPC Judy Hopps (voiced by Ginnifer Goodwin) and Nick Wilde (Jason Bateman) see the sights around the world of 'Zootopia.' (Photo: Disney) 
LOS ANGELES (AP) â€” Zootopia won best animated feature and took home a leading six awards at the 44th Annie Awards, setting up the Disney release as the clear favorite at the Oscars. 
At the Los Angeles ceremony Saturday, Zootopia won for directing and writing. 
One of its leads, Jason Bateman, shared best-voice acting with Auli'i Cravalho from Moana. Along with more than $1 billion in global box office, Zootopia has been the top choice in awards season, also winning a Golden Globe. Abundance of quality animation means tough Oscar fight 
The Annie winner has won the best-animated feature Oscar in 10 of the 15 years since the Academy Awards introduced the category. 
Other Oscar nominees scored other awards. The Red Turtle won best animated independent feature. Kubo and the Two Strings won for character animation, production design and editorial.
